docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 7 Arthur J. Goldberg, chief United States delegate, led a "sit-in" tonight in the Security Council chamber in an attempt to bring about an immediate meeting to discuss the Rhodesian situation.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 7 Arthur J. Goldberg, chief United States delegate, led a "sit-in" tonight in the Security Council chamber in an attempt to bring about an immediate meeting to discuss the Rhodesian situation.
docs.abstract: US Amb Goldberg and Lord Caradon (GB) lead 'sit-in,' UN Security Council, after pres Keita (Mali) fails to respond to Brit request for meeting to authorize use of force in oil embargo; reprs of Netherlands, NZ, Japan, China, Argentina and Uruguay join sit-in; Jordanian and French reprs not present but back it; sit-in ends as Keita, after plea delivered through Sec Gen Thant, agrees to study Brit request; Keita delay linked to 2 sets of consultations, within council itself and among delegations of African states not represented on council but which, with certain council members, belong to African Unity Orgn

headline.main: U.S. Leads 'Sit-In' at U.N. For a Debate on Rhodesia; U.S., IN U.N., SEEKS RHODESIA DEBATE

byline.original: By RAYMOND DANIELL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: ASUNCION, Paraguay  The streetcar is rapidly vanishing from the urban landscape of South  America. Dilapidated opensided trolleys no longer sway on undulating tracks and gongs no longer sound. In city after city, an era is drawing to a close.
docs.lead_paragraph: ASUNCION, Paraguay The streetcar is rapidly vanishing from the urban landscape of South America. Dilapidated opensided trolleys no longer sway on undulating tracks and gongs no longer sound. In city after city, an era is drawing to a close.
docs.abstract: Article on streetcars replacement in principal cities; illus

headline.main: FAREWELL TO THE TROLLEY IN SOUTH AMERICA

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 9 The Security Council authorized Britain tonight to use force to prevent oil from reaching Rhodesia by sea through the port of Beira in Portuguese Mozambique.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 9 The Security Council authorized Britain tonight to use force to prevent oil from reaching Rhodesia by sea through the port of Beira in Portuguese Mozambique.
docs.abstract: Security Council, 10-0, authorizes Brit use of force to bar tankers from Beira; Mali, France, Uruguay Bulgaria and USSR abstain; council rejects series of African amendments to order GB to use force against Smith regime and to cut off Rhodesian land links to Mozambique and S Africa; Goldberg urges African states to be patient; French repr Seydoux denies Rhodesia is threat to internatl peace; holds it internal Brit affair; Keita criticized by Goldberg and Caradon, defended by Soviet and Uganda reprs; Brit Conservatives charge Wilson violates pledge not to impose naval blockade; he replies

headline.main: U.N. COUNCIL BACKS BRITISH ON HALTING OIL SHIPS BY FORCE; Vote on Step to End Breach in Rhodesia Embargo Is 10-0, With 5 Abstaining BRITAIN IS BACKED ON USE OF FORCE

byline.original: By RAYMOND DANIELL Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Rear Adm. Lorenzo C. Farwell. U. S. C. G., retired, died Sunday at the Veterans Administration Hospital, First Avenue and 24th Street. He was 87 years old and lived at 7 Peter Cooper Road.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rear Adm. Lorenzo C. Farwell. U. S. C. G., retired, died Sunday at the Veterans Administration Hospital, First Avenue and 24th Street. He was 87 years old and lived at 7 Peter Cooper Road.

headline.main: ADM. FARWELL, 87, OF COAST GUARD; Retired Officer Who Served for 43 Years Is Dead

docs.snippet: BOSTON, April 11 Seven persons distinguished for their work in the field of mental retardation were given awards totaling $226,000 tonight by the Joseph P. Kennedy Jr. Foundation.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, April 11 Seven persons distinguished for their work in the field of mental retardation were given awards totaling $226,000 tonight by the Joseph P. Kennedy Jr. Foundation.
docs.abstract: Kennedy Foundation symposium on retardation, Boston; awards presented to 7 by Sen E M Kennedy, Dir Shriver and Mrs J P Kennedy; Mrs Shriver, Mrs Lawford and Mrs S Smith attend

headline.main: Kennedy Fund Gives $226,000 To 7 for Helping the Retarded
